content: What is the meaning of the phrase "Fool's Gold"?

"Fool's Gold" is a term used to describe iron pyrite, a mineral that has a superficial resemblance to gold. Its shiny, metallic luster and pale brass-yellow hue can easily deceive people into believing it is real gold, hence the name "Fool's Gold." The phrase is also used metaphorically to describe something that appears valuable or promising but is actually worthless or deceptive.
